H0.text: Coal and natural gas are the sources that add carbon dioxide to the atmosphere among those used to generate most electricity in the United States.

H1.text: Natural gas and nuclear energy add carbon dioxide to the atmosphere when used to generate most electricity in the United States.

H2.text: Nuclear energy and hydropower add carbon dioxide to the atmosphere, as indicated by the question that most electricity in the United States is generated using coal, natural gas, nuclear energy, or hydropower.

H3.text: Hydropower and coal add carbon dioxide to the atmosphere among the sources of electricity generation in the United States, which are primarily coal, natural gas, nuclear energy, or hydropower.

A4.text: In 2018 coal burnt to generate electricity emitted over 10 Gt CO2 of the 34 Gt total from fuel combustion
